intro: Hieracium fallax var. mite, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are usually sterile, and disk florets that are fertile, contributing to its reproductive strategy. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
